intro: Plagiobothrys mollis var. vestitus, commonly known as the white-flowered bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval leaflets and produces distinctive, inflated pods that contain seeds. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils, and is often found in disturbed areas. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and conservation efforts in its native range.
